revised_title: Evolution and Classification of Ascidians: A Study of Tunicate Development
tldr: This article examines the development and variability of the heart, pericardium, and epicardium in ascidians, while also attempting to trace the probable course of their evolution and establish a revised classification for the major divisions of the class. The author argues that the absence of budding and the position of the gut in Ciona suggest that these features are primitive characteristics.
